channel.title: My routine
channel.description: I was wondering, would drinking a 12 or 16 oz sugar free redbull when I get home at the end of the day help me from being sleepy and tired, so I can get my workout routine going? Would it be bad for my routine, as in unhealthy? Or should I try a 5 hour energy. The thing is when I get back from school all I want to do is sleep, so I get my homework done and sleep. I would really like to finish my homework then workout, but it's really hard because I don't eat for 9 hours through the day and get about 7hours of sleep a night. Any tips for not being tired? [Other than coffee]

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

I’d try to eat as much food as you can for breakfast then try to eat when you get home. I seem to have the opposite problem. I find it hard to get through school because I feel tired. Then when I get home I feel energized and I can get through to 1:00am without feeling tired. I think my biological clock is off, and yours might be off too. Try getting on the routine you want (force yourself to go to sleep later) and your body will start getting used to it.

Whenever I struggle with that I reset my biological clock in a sense. Pull an allnighter, and then go to bed early that night. You’ll wake up refreshed and in a good sleeping pattern.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

I’ll just repeat what just about everyone in this thread has said: if you don’t eat, you will get tired and won’t have the energy to do anything. Besides, if you don’t eat you might as well skip school completely because the learning efficiency on an empty stomach is close to zero. I don’t know about the ventilation in your classrooms, but the old part of our school lacks ventilation, so after half an hour or so you get tired.

Shall we make sure he reads it?

[size=40pt]if you don’t eat, you will get tired and won’t have the energy to do anything.[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You’re not allowed to eat for 9 hours straight? Our teachers always put in a 10 minute break if we have more then 2 hours in the same classroom. And some don’t even care if you are eating during the lesson. Can’t you eat between two classes?

I’ll just repeat what just about everyone in this thread has said: if you don’t eat, you will get tired and won’t have the energy to do anything. Besides, if you don’t eat you might as well skip school completely because the learning efficiency on an empty stomach is close to zero. I don’t know about the ventilation in your classrooms, but the old part of our school lacks ventilation, so after half an hour or so you get tired.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Mr.Chris is right, a workout routine is completely useless if you’re not even eating. It’s simple, eat more + train more = you’ll bulk up (assuming you’re not retarded and actually have some form of diet).

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:2, topic:361131”]7 hours is more than fucking enough, your body is accustomed to too much sleep. Start sleeping 5 hours a night for a few months, then go back to your 7 hour a night thing and it will be more than sufficient.

Back in like 7th grade, if I got anything less than 8 hours of sleep, I would be a walking zombie all day. Now, however, 4 hours of sleep gets me through the day with quite ease. However, on weekends for instance, I sleep around 8-9 hours (with luck), but when I wake up, I’m yet more tired than if would have slept 4-6 hours since I have accumulated tiredness from all year around.[/quote]
Because the younger you are the more you sleep. Up until you’re about 20+ you can sleep 10-12 hours a time. But i can go through the day fine with 6 or 5 hours of sleep, depending on how the night went.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:4, topic:361131”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=457419.msg3347685#msg3347685 date=1284947302]
7 hours is more than fucking enough, your body is accustomed to too much sleep. Start sleeping 5 hours a night for a few months, then go back to your 7 hour a night thing and it will be more than sufficient.

Back in like 7th grade, if I got anything less than 8 hours of sleep, I would be a walking zombie all day. Now, however, 4 hours of sleep gets me through the day with quite ease. However, on weekends for instance, I sleep around 8-9 hours (with luck), but when I wake up, I’m yet more tired than if would have slept 4-6 hours since I have accumulated tiredness from all year around.
[/quote]
You assume way to fucking much. I don’t know if you can fucking read, or you read the parts you can flame about. I don’t eat for 9 hours through the day, and when I get back home I don’t eat much because I have to get to studying, and then I fucking crash. My brain and body are extremely tired by 6:00. I’m sorry to say, but personally I don’t need to hear about what works for you.[/quote]Where the fuck was the assumption in any of what I said? It was a response to your explicit stating of the fact that you sleep 7 hours and you are still tired when you come home. Yes, you don’t eat for 9 hours; obviously that affects your state of energy, but then if you already knew that and are so fucking close minded to other opinions, why the fuck bother posting this thread? And seriously, remind yourself that you are way too new at these forums, and new at using any forums for that matter, since you obviously do not know what the fuck the term “flaming” means since there was no implicit offense implied in the post. But I guess scanning a post with your ass for any potentially offensive terms and then crying flame is just attributed to your helpless moparscaper mentality.

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:9, topic:361131”]@original daniel
Yeah I’m up at 6:30, at school at 8:00 and don’t get out until 3:00. Then I have to do 2 hours of study when I get home. No breaks but a study hall which I can’t eat in. I’m not able to eat in any of my classes except for lunch seeing as it’s against the rules.[/quote]So why don’t you eat at lunch…and/or when you come back from school while allegedly studying. You purposely starve yourself and then bitch about not having energy, fuck off.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:7, topic:361131”]You don’t get a lunch break or a morning break at school? That’s gotta be against some sort of law. Here in the UK, iirc, schools have to give students something like 40 mins time off by law to have some lunch and do some sport.

Basically, you’re never gonna succeed in a good workout routine if you’re not eating properly. End of. No way around it I’m afraid.[/quote]
Yeah I’ll go speak to my councilor tomorrow to see what I can do. I know it’s require but I said it was fine if I didn’t have it last year for this year. I might have to drop a class to get it and that would severely fuck my gpa for the quarter. Hopefully we can do some schedule shifting with the two study halls I have and we can make it work.

@original daniel
Yeah I’m up at 6:30, at school at 8:00 and don’t get out until 3:00. Then I have to do 2 hours of study when I get home. No breaks but a study hall which I can’t eat in. I’m not able to eat in any of my classes except for lunch seeing as it’s against the rules.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Yeah you need a lunch break. Do you really study 9 hours a day straight every day?

I’m sure you have a spare 5 minutes here and there throughout the day to cram something down. Being fruit, nuts, rice with fish/chicken etc. I have long and busy days and still eat plenty.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

You don’t get a lunch break or a morning break at school? That’s gotta be against some sort of law. Here in the UK, iirc, schools have to give students something like 40 mins time off by law to have some lunch and do some sport.

Basically, you’re never gonna succeed in a good workout routine if you’re not eating properly. End of. No way around it I’m afraid.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:5, topic:361131”]Mate, I really wouldn’t start working out until you’re eating proper foods and drinking a lot of water. Sure, a Red Bull will give you some quick energy, but not enough to power you through a 1 and a half hour workout.

I say start eating about 5 small meals a day, all of them healthy. Much protein is always good, as well as carbs for some energy. Although, specific foods relate to what you want to achieve. Weight loss? Muscle growth? Both? Also, what you do in your routine is pretty important, in order to get the best results.

Water is pretty important. I try to make sure I’ve always got a bottle of water in my hand, so I drink around 5-7 bottles of water a day. If you don’t drink water much, you’ll see a huge improvement in your energy and mind if that’s all you drink.

IMO, simply having a high sugar energy drink isn’t going to be hugely beneficial + I believe they can mess up your insides if you drink enough of them. Rather than adding a drink, make some changes to your lifestyle and you’ll see quick improvements.

I tend to have around 6-8 hours sleep if I have a busy day, but if I’m having a lazy, do nothing day, I can sleep for 12 hours but then have no energy.

I think the main cause for your exhaustion is lack of the correct foods and drink.[/quote]
You’re probably correct, I just don’t know how to fit lunch into my schedule, seeing as every period of the day I have a class, and when I don’t it’s a study hall period that isn’t a lunch period.

Read full topic

item.title: My routine
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Mate, I really wouldn’t start working out until you’re eating proper foods and drinking a lot of water. Sure, a Red Bull will give you some quick energy, but not enough to power you through a 1 and a half hour workout.

I say start eating about 5 small meals a day, all of them healthy. Much protein is always good, as well as carbs for some energy. Although, specific foods relate to what you want to achieve. Weight loss? Muscle growth? Both? Also, what you do in your routine is pretty important, in order to get the best results.

Water is pretty important. I try to make sure I’ve always got a bottle of water in my hand, so I drink around 5-7 bottles of water a day. If you don’t drink water much, you’ll see a huge improvement in your energy and mind if that’s all you drink.

IMO, simply having a high sugar energy drink isn’t going to be hugely beneficial + I believe they can mess up your insides if you drink enough of them. Rather than adding a drink, make some changes to your lifestyle and you’ll see quick improvements.

I tend to have around 6-8 hours sleep if I have a busy day, but if I’m having a lazy, do nothing day, I can sleep for 12 hours but then have no energy.

I think the main cause for your exhaustion is lack of the correct foods and drink.

Read full topic

[quote=“abraham2119, post:2, topic:361131”]7 hours is more than fucking enough, your body is accustomed to too much sleep. Start sleeping 5 hours a night for a few months, then go back to your 7 hour a night thing and it will be more than sufficient.

Back in like 7th grade, if I got anything less than 8 hours of sleep, I would be a walking zombie all day. Now, however, 4 hours of sleep gets me through the day with quite ease. However, on weekends for instance, I sleep around 8-9 hours (with luck), but when I wake up, I’m yet more tired than if would have slept 4-6 hours since I have accumulated tiredness from all year around.[/quote]

I don’t eat for 9 hours through the day, and when I get back home I don’t eat much because I have to get to studying, and then I fucking crash. My brain and body are extremely tired by 6:00. I’m sorry to say, but personally I don’t need to hear about what works for you.

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:3, topic:361131”]You need to eat. That’s why you have no energy.

If you don’t eat for 9 hours then your body is going to start using muscle for energy, rending your workout useless.[/quote]
I was thinking about having a few granola bars through the day. Eating a lot in the morning then having like 3 granola bars until I get home. Would that help if anything?

@cows_be_sacred wrote:

I was wondering, would drinking a 12 or 16 oz sugar free redbull when I get home at the end of the day help me from being sleepy and tired, so I can get my workout routine going? Would it be bad for my routine, as in unhealthy? Or should I try a 5 hour energy. The thing is when I get back from school all I want to do is sleep, so I get my homework done and sleep. I would really like to finish my homework then workout, but it’s really hard because I don’t eat for 9 hours through the day and get about 7hours of sleep a night. Any tips for not being tired? [Other than coffee]
